main.name: Gary Burner
main.description: and recent graduate from Penn's LPS Web Development bootcamp.
main.bio: At each stop in my career I've strived to improve processes, incorporate data into decision making, and find creative solutions to complex problems. After enrolling in Penn LPS, an intensive 24 week full stack JavaScript course, I am confident that I have the tools necessary to build these solutions from the ground up.
main.contactmessage: Please feel free to email me if you would like to work together or just to say hi.

education.description: A 24 week long bootcamp dedicated to designing and building web applications. Skills learned include HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Node.js, MySQL, MongoDB, Express, and React.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: Git is my version control tool of choice. We used Git extensively on all group projects during Penn LPS

skills.name: React
skills.description: I love using React - it's my front end framework of choice. I've built a reporting dashboard and a marketplace app in React.

skills.name: Mongo DB
skills.description: I am still getting comfortable with Mongo, but I enjoy the flexibility it offers.

skills.name: SQL
skills.description: SQL peaked my interest in web development. I first learned to write SQL queries at Red Spark and still enjoy using SQL.

skills.name: Bootstrap
skills.description: I'm most familiar with Bootstrap and it's always my go-to to get something off of the ground quickly.

skills.name: NodeJs
skills.description: Node is my serverside scripting language of choice. The majority of my projects I've built use MERN and I always enjoy the flexibility Node offers.

skills.name: Heroku
skills.description: We've deployed all of our class projects on Heroku, and I'm happy to use it for a quick and simple solution.

skills.name: AWS
skills.description: I'm new to AWS but I's facinated by the flexibility and varietly of solutions AWS offers. I'm looking forward to learing, and using, AWS more.
